greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: the (n-k)-th term of the k-fold iterated partial sum of the pentagonal numbers.
reference: Albert H. Beiler, "Recreations in the Theory of Numbers", Dover, 1966, p 189.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011(rows 0 to 140, flattened)
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: A125232 := proc(n,k) option remember ; if k = 0 then A000326(n) ; elif k = n-1 then 1 ; else procname(n-1,k)+procname(n-1,k-1) ; fi : end: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 09 2008
mathematica: nmax = 11; col[1] = Table[n(3n-1)/2, {n, 1, nmax}]; col[k_] := col[k] = Prepend[Accumulate[col[k-1]], 0]; Table[col[k][[n]], {n, 1, nmax}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 25 2019 *)
xref: Columns: A000326 (pentagonal numbers), A002411, A001296, A051836, A051923.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 24 2006
ext: Edited and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 09 2008
